Note: In order to work, this extension requires an application to serve emotes according to this API specification.
Saving these options requires refreshing Element.

This URL has to point to the /emotes path of the emote server.

This can be left blank if the emote server does not require an access key.

The default emote size when emotes are mixed with text.
Has to be a value compatible with the CSS property font-size.
(default: 2em)

The emote size for standalone emotes (without text in the same message).
Has to be a value compatible with the CSS property font-size.
(default: 4em)

If enabled, animated emotes (GIF, APNG) will be frozen when Element is not focused.
(default: false)

The number of emote suggestions shown at the same time.
(default: 10)

Whether to use fuzzy matching for emote suggestions or not.
When disabled, simple case-insensitive string matching will be used instead.
(default: true)

The location factor used for the fuzzy matching relevance score of the emote names.
See here and here to learn how to adjust it.
(default: 0)

The distance factor used for the fuzzy matching relevance score of the emote names.
See here and here to learn how to adjust it.
(default: 100)

The threshold factor used for the fuzzy matching relevance score of the emote names.
See here and here to learn how to adjust it.
(default: 0.6)

If an emote name contains a string from this list (use | to separate the strings) it will be excluded from the emote suggestions.

The eight available username colors. If the Element default for a specific color is set (or no value is entered at all), no CSS will be generated for the respective color.
(defaults: see input placeholders)
